page.title: 10SCAWSBY HALL AND FARM 2
page.content: The kitchen at the hall is much older than Tudor. The kitchen and hall (now partitioned) were once a single roomed manor house.A huge tree trunk beam goes right across the ceiling and the walls are nearly a metre thick. There is a loft that you get to up a ladder and through a trap- door. It was probably where they slept. The Tudor house is brick built and covered with cement. Some of the glass is Tudor too. There is a bar on one wall they used for hanging people. The farm buildings were mostly made of stone. There were lots of stables next to each other with split doors, where the farm horses lived. We also saw a wall with holes in it, it was a pig feeder from the olden days. The store buildings were dark and stuffy. There were holes in the doors to let the cats in and out and air vents too.
